00026 # ifdef BOOST_ITERATOR_REF_CONSTNESS_KILLS_WRITABILITY
00027 #  include <boost/python/detail/indirect_traits.hpp>

00029 
00030 //
00031 // iterator_category deduction for iterator_facade
00032 //
00033 
00034 // forward declaration
00035 namespace boost { struct use_default; }
00036 
00037 namespace boost { namespace detail  {
00038 
00039 struct input_output_iterator_tag
00040   : std::input_iterator_tag
00041 {
00042     // Using inheritance for only input_iterator_tag helps to avoid
00043     // ambiguities when a stdlib implementation dispatches on a
00044     // function which is overloaded on both input_iterator_tag and
00045     // output_iterator_tag, as STLPort does, in its __valid_range
00046     // function.  I claim it's better to avoid the ambiguity in these
00047     // cases.
00048     operator std::output_iterator_tag() const
00049     {
00050         return std::output_iterator_tag();
00051     }
00052 };
00053 
00054 //
00055 // True iff the user has explicitly disabled writability of this
00056 // iterator.  Pass the iterator_facade's Value parameter and its
00057 // nested ::reference type.
00058 //
00059 template <class ValueParam, class Reference>
00060 struct iterator_writability_disabled
00061 # ifdef BOOST_ITERATOR_REF_CONSTNESS_KILLS_WRITABILITY // Adding Thomas' logic?
00062   : mpl::or_<
00063         is_const<Reference>
00064       , python::detail::is_reference_to_const<Reference>
00065       , is_const<ValueParam>
00066     >
00067 # else 
00068   : is_const<ValueParam>
00069 # endif 
00070 {};
00071 
00072 
00073 //
00074 // Convert an iterator_facade's traversal category, Value parameter,
00075 // and ::reference type to an appropriate old-style category.
00076 //
00077 // If writability has been disabled per the above metafunction, the
00078 // result will not be convertible to output_iterator_tag.
00079 //
00080 // Otherwise, if Traversal == single_pass_traversal_tag, the following
00081 // conditions will result in a tag that is convertible both to
00082 // input_iterator_tag and output_iterator_tag:
00083 //
00084 //    1. Reference is a reference to non-const
00085 //    2. Reference is not a reference and is convertible to Value
00086 //
00087 template <class Traversal, class ValueParam, class Reference>
00088 struct iterator_facade_default_category
00089   : mpl::apply_if<
00090         mpl::and_<
00091             is_reference<Reference>
00092           , is_convertible<Traversal,forward_traversal_tag>
00093         >
00094       , mpl::apply_if<
00095             is_convertible<Traversal,random_access_traversal_tag>
00096           , mpl::identity<std::random_access_iterator_tag>
00097           , mpl::if_<
00098                 is_convertible<Traversal,bidirectional_traversal_tag>
00099               , std::bidirectional_iterator_tag
00100               , std::forward_iterator_tag
00101             >
00102         >
00103       , typename mpl::apply_if<
00104             mpl::and_<
00105                 is_convertible<Traversal, single_pass_traversal_tag>
00106                 
00107                 // check for readability
00108               , is_convertible<Reference, ValueParam>
00109             >
00110           , mpl::if_<
00111                 iterator_writability_disabled<ValueParam,Reference>
00112               , std::input_iterator_tag
00113               , input_output_iterator_tag
00114             >
00115             
00116           , mpl::identity<std::output_iterator_tag>
00117         >
00118     >
00119 {
00120 };
00121 
00122 // True iff T is convertible to an old-style iterator category.
00123 template <class T>
00124 struct is_iterator_category
00125   : mpl::or_<
00126         is_convertible<T,std::input_iterator_tag>
00127       , is_convertible<T,std::output_iterator_tag>
00128     >
00129 {
00130 };
00131 
00132 template <class T>
00133 struct is_iterator_traversal
00134   : is_convertible<T,incrementable_traversal_tag>
00135 {};
00136 
00137 //
00138 // A composite iterator_category tag convertible to Category (a pure
00139 // old-style category) and Traversal (a pure traversal tag).
00140 // Traversal must be a strict increase of the traversal power given by
00141 // Category.
00142 //
00143 template <class Category, class Traversal>
00144 struct iterator_category_with_traversal
00145   : Category, Traversal
00146 {
00147 # if 0
00148     // Because of limitations on multiple user-defined conversions,
00149     // this should be a good test of whether convertibility is enough
00150     // in the spec, or whether we need to specify inheritance.
00151     operator Category() const { return Category(); }
00152     operator Traversal() const { return Traversal(); }
00153 # endif
00154     
00155 # if !BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1300)
00156     // Make sure this isn't used to build any categories where
00157     // convertibility to Traversal is redundant.  Should just use the
00158     // Category element in that case.
00159     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(
00160         !(is_convertible<
00161               typename iterator_category_to_traversal<Category>::type
00162             , Traversal
00163           >::value));
00164 
00165     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(is_iterator_category<Category>::value);
00166     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(!is_iterator_category<Traversal>::value);
00167     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(!is_iterator_traversal<Category>::value);
00168 #  if !BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, BOOST_TESTED_AT(1310))
00169     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(is_iterator_traversal<Traversal>::value);
00170 #  endif 
00171 # endif 
00172 };
00173 
00174 // Computes an iterator_category tag whose traversal is Traversal and
00175 // which is appropriate for an iterator
00176 template <class Traversal, class ValueParam, class Reference>
00177 struct facade_iterator_category_impl
00178 {
00179 # if !BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1300)
00180     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT(!is_iterator_category<Traversal>::value);
00181 # endif 
00182     
00183     typedef typename iterator_facade_default_category<
00184         Traversal,ValueParam,Reference
00185     >::type category;
00186     
00187     typedef typename mpl::if_<
00188         is_same<
00189             Traversal
00190           , typename iterator_category_to_traversal<category>::type
00191         >
00192       , category
00193       , iterator_category_with_traversal<category,Traversal>
00194     >::type type;
00195 };
00196 
00197 //
00198 // Compute an iterator_category for iterator_facade
00199 //
00200 template <class CategoryOrTraversal, class ValueParam, class Reference>
00201 struct facade_iterator_category
00202   : mpl::apply_if<
00203         is_iterator_category<CategoryOrTraversal>
00204       , mpl::identity<CategoryOrTraversal> // old-style categories are fine as-is
00205       , facade_iterator_category_impl<CategoryOrTraversal,ValueParam,Reference>
00206     >
00207 {
00208 };
00209 
00210 }} // namespace boost::detail
